intro: Aloe × smaragdina, commonly known as the Jade Plant or Crassula ovata, is a hybrid plant resulting from the cross between Aloe arborescens and Aloe vera. It is characterized by its dense, fleshy, and succulent leaves that are typically green with a powdery white coating. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers during the spring or summer months. It is native to South Africa and is widely cultivated as a decorative houseplant due to its ease of care and attractive appearance. Aloe × smaragdina is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-draining soil and bright, indirect sunlight.
